N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 21 ยง 2605.7 - Application and financial assistance process

State Regulations
(a) At any time after the issuance of a
confirmation letter by the corporation, the project sponsor may submit a
completed application to the corporation for the purpose of obtaining the
financial assistance identified in the confirmation letter. Such completed
application may include evidence of: (1)
financial commitments to complete the project; (2)
all necessary approvals and
permits; (3)
all final plans and
designs; (4)
bond
resolutions; (5)
all necessary

State Environmental Quality Review Act approvals; (6)
satisfaction of security agreements as
outlined in section
2605.8
of this Part; and
(7)
any additional information the
corporation may require. (b) After a project sponsor has submitted an
application satisfactory to the corporation, the corporation shall provide
financial assistance through the execution of a PFLA with the project
sponsor. (c) Any PFLA for an
eligible project shall include a schedule for the completion of the entire
project and an agreement by the recipient to complete the entire project in
accordance with that project completion schedule regardless of the availability
of future assistance from the fund. Notes
